greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1; for n>1, a(n)=a(n-1)-4 if n is already in the sequence, a(n)=a(n-1)+5 otherwise.
comment: a(n)-n is eventually periodic with period 18. - _Ivan Neretin_, Mar 03 2016
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
B. Cloitre, N. J. A. Sloane and M. J. Vandermast, Numerical analogues of Aronson's sequence, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 6 (2003), #03.2.2.
B. Cloitre, N. J. A. Sloane and M. J. Vandermast, Numerical analogues of Aronson's sequence, arXiv:math/0305308 [math.NT], 2003.
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 01 2003
